intro: Philippia oophylla, commonly known as the yellow bellflower, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and branching. Philippia oophylla is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and botanical collections.
